abstract: Libya's provisional leadership faces difficult questions regarding those still loyal to Col Muammar el-Qaddafi, as it tries to establish legitimate government; battle for Surt, last pro-Qaddafi city, has stretched on far longer than expected, compounding sectarian strife and barring path to reconciliation.
snippet: The battle for Surt underscores the problem Libya’s weak transitional government faces as it tries to stitch together a country divided by the war.

lead_paragraph: The battle for Surt underscores the problem Libya’s weak transitional government faces as it tries to stitch together a country divided by the war.

headline.main: Battle for a Holdout City Stalls Healing in Libya
headline.print_headline: Battle for a Holdout City Stalls Healing in Libya
headline.seo: Battle for Surt Threatens Libya’s Healing Process
